item.description: Functions: the killer JavaScript feature we never talk about. JavaScript is a very in-demand language today. item.title: Recursion in JavaScript with ES6, destructuring and rest/spread
item.description: The latest ECMA standard for JavaScript (ECMAScript 6) makes JavaScript more readable by encouraging a more declarative style with functional constructs and new operators. For arrays this means for example: var [first, second] = [1, 2, 3, 4]; // first: 1 // second: 2 There‚Äôs more you can do, like skip some members of the array on the right-hand side of the operation.

item.title: Writing an npm module with TypeScript and microbundle
item.description: For those looking to write a package and publish it to npm, TypeScript + microbundle is a low-friction way to build a high-quality library. Why TypeScript?
